question: In which year were the first modern Olympic Games held?
funFact: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896, reviving the ancient Greek tradition after a 1,500-year hiatus.

question: What do the five Olympic rings represent?
funFact: The five interlocking rings represent the five continents (Africa, Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania) and the unity of athletes from around the world.

question: What is the Olympic motto?
C: The Battle of the Somme (World War I)
funFact: The Olympic motto is 'Citius, Altius, Fortius' (Latin for 'Faster, Higher, Stronger'), which was adopted in 1894 and remains the official motto today.

question: How often are the Summer Olympic Games held?
funFact: The Summer Olympic Games are held every four years, following the ancient Greek tradition. The Winter Olympics also occur every four years, but in alternating two-year intervals.

question: Which city has hosted the Summer Olympics three times?
funFact: London has hosted the Summer Olympics three times: in 1908, 1948, and 2012, making it the only city to have hosted the modern Games three times.

question: What is the name of the Olympic flame ceremony?
funFact: The Olympic Torch Relay begins with the lighting of the flame in Olympia, Greece, and ends with the lighting of the cauldron at the opening ceremony of the host city.

question: Which sport has been included in every modern Summer Olympics?
funFact: Athletics (track and field), swimming, and gymnastics have been included in every modern Summer Olympic Games since 1896.

question: What color are the Olympic rings?
B: Blue, yellow, black, green, and red
funFact: The Olympic rings are blue, yellow, black, green, and red on a white background. At least one of these colors appears in every national flag.

question: Which country has won the most Olympic gold medals overall?
funFact: The United States has won more Olympic gold medals than any other country, with over 1,000 gold medals across all Summer and Winter Games.

question: What do Olympic athletes receive for first, second, and third place?
funFact: Olympic athletes receive gold (first place), silver (second place), and bronze (third place) medals. The tradition dates back to the 1904 St. Louis Games.
